item.description:
http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KIJD&state=CT

 

 

Plans are now finalized for the 3rd annual camping event in East Lyme CT. 

Pristine Lake (Powers Lake) surrounded by 1500 private maintained acres owned by Yale University in their outdoor club.

A Weekend of Friendship at the Lake, Our Traditional Barbeques, hiking, kayaking, lounging around the lake or campfire --  and use of the clubs boats.  *kayaks, rowboats, paddleboats, canoes*. 

 Available at Club, included in your cost: Rowboats, canoes, kayaks.   (life jackets are available and must be worn).   Blazed hiking trails around a wildlife marsh, pond, clay volleyball court, horse-shoe pit, small basketball court, field office, and recreation cabin with ping pong.   A spring water dispenser is located in the Pavilion.

Cost:

$25/pp for the weekend (camping) details are below (limited to 25 people)

$11/pp for day picnic, details are below (limited to 25 people)

(You can bring your own kayak, canoe, but, due to insurance reasons must use the state launch area -- see details below.)

BARBARA  is HOSTING THIS EVENT. 
please contact her for questions @ bg3step@comcast.net

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please reserve your spot now -- we are limited to 25 people for the campout and additionally another 25 for the barbeque on Saturday 

Facility: Yale Univ. Outdoor Center, East Lyme 

Location:
Yale Outdoor Education Ctr
298 Upper Pattagansett Rd
East Lyme, CT 06333

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

CAMPING PEOPLE (limited to 25 people):  Cost:  $25pp

If you want to camp, then I will need $25/pp in *advance (address listed below) as well as an RSVP to secure your spot.  Right now, I am securing 5 campsites but will add as the numbers increase.  There are only 9 sites available which tend to book up, so please, if you are interested in camping send me your $ and your RSVP by June 10; see below and/or email:   Bg3step@comcast.net

  Recommended equipment:   Tent, air mattress, sleeping bag, flash light, bug repellant, sun lotion and any snacks and other things to make your stay enjoyable.

Meals:   We potluck most of our meals under several canopies and group picnic tables.

 How to secure a spote and where to send the money:

Send a check by June 10 payable to: Barbara, 3 Stephanie Court, Madison CT  06443

Write a note: Your name, your email and your cell phone for contact information. You will receive a confirmation via email.

 

State boat launch area - kayak and canoe information:

 

Kayaks/Canoes

The facility offers kayaks, canoes and rowboats.  If you care to bring your own, then you will need to put in on the state boat ramp (located around the block); Directions: out of the facility, bear sharply right, follow road for about 1-2 miles, boat launch is on the right

gps: http://www.kids.ct.gov/Dep/cwp/view.asp?a=2686&q=384254&depNav_GID=1620

 

Or:   http://connecticutwatertrails.com/CWTA%20-%20Connecticut%20Boat%20Launches%20-%20New%20London%20County%20-%20East%20Lyme%20-%20Powers%20Lake%20Boat%20Launch.htm

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SATURDAY GROUP PARTY by the lakeside:

Saturday we will have our Traditional "Pot Luck Lakeside Barbeque so please bring either a dessert, or side dish to share for eight, and your own grilling item.   Remember to bring a chair or blanket and the usual summer relaxing necessities.

Al and Barbara will bring their gas grills; there will also be charcoal for the grills.  Papergoods, ice and soft drinks will be provided.

BEHAVIOR:
This is a private club reserved and organized by a member who works at Yale, so please be courteous and responsible as this is where she works! Drink responsibly and please keep your space clean.

SINCE THIS HAS TO BE A PRE-PAID AND PRE-RESERVED EVENT -- IF it rains WE WILL STILL PARTY USING THE INSIDE/COVERED FACILITIES. We are plan on putting canopies together for shelter.  Hopefully mother nature will cooperate as she did last year!

Hope to see you there! Oh, and please remember to RSVP. Thanks!!

Driving Directions:

Yale Outdoor Education Ctr

298 Upper Pattagansett Rd East Lyme, CT

 From I-95 North:
to Exit 71 (Four Mile River Rd -- East Lyme), turn right off exit ramp and continue 1-1/2 miles to end of the road. Turn right onto Route 1, continue another 1-1/2 miles, turn left onto Scott Road. (right past the SCOTT’s FARM MARKET) Continue straight two miles to front entrance (directly across the road) This is the intersection of Scott road and Pattagansett Road. Enter property and follow dirt road (which bears to the left) by a Hall then go less than querter mile.; LOOK FOR THE ORANGE POLE BY THE SITE DRIVE WAY.

  Driving Directions: From HARTFORD:

Yes it kind of confusing..

Take I-84 East apx 0.5 miles to (exit # 55) rte 2 East toward Norwich.

Follow rte 2 for 24 miles to rte 11 (exit # 19).

Take rte 11 for 7.5 miles to (exit # 4) for rte 82.

Take a right (toward Hadlyme) onto rte 82 THEN TAKE AN IMMEDIATE LEFT onto DARLING Rd.

Follow Darling Rd to its end apx 1 mile Take a Left onto GUNGY rd follow for apx 2.8 miles

Take a left at Beaver Brook rd go apx 1 mile and continue strait on Whistletown Rd for 2.1 miles to the intersection of Pattagansett and Scott rd,

THE ENTRANCE TO YALE NATURE CENTER IS OPPOSITE SCOTT RD.

Enter property and follow dirt road (which bears to the left) by a Hall then go less than querter mile.; LOOK FOR THE ORANGE POLE BY THE SITE DRIVE WAY.

look for my Orange 6 foot pole by our camping area.

 

MORE DETAILS WILL BE ADDED LATER if necessary,

AL-R
item.how_to_find_us: Campsites 4,5,6,7,8: LOOK FOR THE 6 foot tall ORANGE POLE & Traffic Cones BY ROAD to our CAMPSITE AREA (S)
item.why: This has been a very successful, enjoyable event for all; lot's of positive feedback!

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT

item.name: Camping Weekend in East Lyme on Private Lake and Private Club
